poem:
### Perceptions and Defenses

Images flicker—  
mature, innocuous, they say,  
softened edges in dim light,  
a dance of words to sway;  
between shadows and claims,  
truth wavers,  
fragile honesty  
in a court of whispers—  
where friendships  
and facades  
collide.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jes Staley received images of ‘mature women’ from Jeffrey Epstein, court hears Images received by the former Barclays chief executive Jes Staley from child sexual abuse offender Jeffrey Epstein were of “mature women” and ultimately “innocuous”, his lawyers have argued, as they tried to discredit claims that the ex-banking boss lied about the depth of the two men’s relationship. The comments were made on the first day of a legal battle in which Staley is". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
